headline: Applied Materials' shares drop as stringent US export curbs weigh on China business
summary: (Reuters) -Applied Materials shares slid 5% before the bell on Friday as the chip ​equipment maker forecast reduced spending in China next year due to stringent U.‌S. export curbs.  The U.S. government has cracked down on foreign companies, especially from ‌China, that use subsidiaries and affiliates to circumvent export curbs on chipmaking tools and related products, hurting sales of Applied Materials and its rivals.  China is the world's largest buyer of chipmaking tools since 2020.

headline: 2 Mooning  Stocks with Impressive Fundamentals and 1 We Brush Off
summary: Great things are happening to the stocks in this article. They’re all outperforming the market over the last month because of positive catalysts such as a new product line, constructive news flow, or even a loyal Reddit fanbase.
